nodes.bodyText: The onMessageFunction default implementation can be an empty function or a debug log.

I think in all the other cases, we simply tap the flow. In other words, the core functionality stays the same regardless of what we are doing. Doing what is suggested make this function inconsistent with the other two if I am not mistaken.

If we go with just functions as suggested above, we wouldn't need the type test. But generally, it is less expensive to check if a variable is () rather than a specific type, so if we are going with this approach let's invert the check.
